fields.summary: Bamboo does not start on OpenJDK 7
Update Dragon slayer documentation to use 64 bit JDK for 64bit O/S

fields.description:
The user logs in. He navigates to the plan he wants to make his favorite, such as http://bamboo.mycompany.com/bamboo/browse/PLAN, then clicks the "star" button. The page refreshes and he's logged out (you can see the "Log In" link on the header banner). The same thing happens from the All Plans tab, http://bamboo.mycompany.com/bamboo/start.action?selectedTab=allPlansTab. What's odd is that it doesn't happen to everyone, me for example. I'm the admin of the plan, and I work on a PC not a Mac and I've never had this problem. 

If it's just a permissions issue, I think the user experience should be improved. Otherwise it seems to be some kind of bug causing the user to be logged out.
fields.summary: User is logged out when marking a plan as a favourite

fields.description:
When the UPM UI is viewed, followed by any other UI the UPM resources are also included on the next page. This can be seen quite easily by looking at the html that is output.

From a bit of investigation com.atlassian.bamboo.filter.RequestCacheThreadLocalFilter should be run for any request that returns html to clear the webResource cache. It is only shown for .action or /s/* 

Fragment from web.xml

{code:xml}
  <filter-mapping>
    <filter-name>requestCache</filter-name>
    <url-pattern>/s/*</url-pattern>
    <dispatcher>REQUEST</dispatcher>
    <dispatcher>FORWARD</dispatcher>
  </filter-mapping>

  <filter-mapping>
    <filter-name>requestCache</filter-name>
    <url-pattern>*.action</url-pattern>
    <dispatcher>REQUEST</dispatcher>
    <dispatcher>FORWARD</dispatcher>
  </filter-mapping>
  <filter> 
    <filter-name>requestCache</filter-name>
    <filter-class>com.atlassian.bamboo.filter.RequestCacheThreadLocalFilter</filter-class>
  </filter>
{code}

Adding /plugins/servlet/* as a filter mapping would solve the issue I was running into (the same script being included multiple times)
fields.summary: Webresources from servlets leak onto the next page

fields.description:
The current documentation on the Bamboo to have external user management with JIRA is not clear:
* http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Integrating+Bamboo+with+Crowd

We might need to provide a more details steps for the configuration:

+At JIRA+

# Configure the Application via Administration >> Other Applications
Please specify the Application name, Password and IP Addresses. The Ip address should be the ip of the Bamboo server
# Save the changes

+At Bamboo+

# Configure the user management as mentioned in the following documentation:
** http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Integrating+Bamboo+with+Crowd

Also, you might want to include the following information:
{quote}
 username case has to line up across all of that! ldap isn't normally case-sensitive.
{quote}

(i) Note, We don't have a page on Using JIRA for user management with Bamboo, we should create it.
fields.summary: Need more information on current documentation for  Bamboo to use external user management with JIRA

fields.description:
I'd like to be able to run one plan but have multiple parameterized runs of that same plan.  The key is here then I only have to modify one plan in one spot rather than cloning the existing plan and changing the parameters there.  This is key for plans that have a high number of jobs.  When you need to make changes to the tasks inside, if you had to clone your plan, then you need to edit multiple plans.

So I could then run my CI trunk plan against JDK 6 and JDK 7, for example, without cloning.  

Certainly, allowing environment variables, capabilities and builders to be selected at the plan level would help this editing nightmare, but I think this is a great idea as part of the "run parameterized" concept.

It's almost a plan within plans.
fields.summary: Run parameterized plan automatically from one plan without having to clone

fields.description: This issue resolves feedback from CR-BAM-3295.
fields.summary: Improve wording and placement of synchronisation time warning

fields.description:
It would be great if the new release management prio to version 3.2 able to enable user to automatically set the version number for maven using the version number from Jira. This feature is actually presented in BRMP plugin as mentioned in the following documentation:
* http://blogs.atlassian.com/devtools/2010/09/bamboo-jira-release-management-plugin-part-2.html
fields.summary: Enable user to automatically set the version number for maven using the version number from Jira

fields.description:
If I want to stream line my jobs and tasks, I'd like to be able to move tasks from one job to another within a stage.
I would also like to be able to move the task from one job to another job in another stage.
fields.summary: As a user I want to be able to drag tasks into jobs in other stages

fields.description:
Bamboo 3.2 users the Crowd/LDAP files located at *<Bamboo-Home-Dir>/xml-data/configuration/*

However we are still distributing them at *<Bamboo-Install>/webapp/WEB-INF/classes/*
fields.summary: Stop distributing the user management files at <Bamboo-Install>/webapp/WEB-INF/classes/

fields.summary: Cannot install plugins onto JBAC using the UPM in Chrome
Tunnel does not reconnect in all cases and has network-stack dependent timeouts

fields.description:
When editing/deleting settings, it'd be great if the confirmation dialog actually provided context as to which one I was deleting.

See screenshot.
fields.summary: In the confirmation dialog's when deleting settings, agents, etc - name the "item" your deleting.

fields.description: Bamboo should have built-in support for [Gradle Builder|http://www.gradle.org/]
fields.summary: Support Gradle builder

fields.description: See attachment - only in wallboard mode - normal mode is ok.
fields.summary: build status gadget over-escapes link in wallboard mode

fields.description:
We have some jobs that are assigned to specific agents for security reasons.  Those minor jobs do not take long to complete so those agents also do other work.  We are running into an issue where some long running jobs are running on those specific agents and the minor jobs (which are higher priority) can not run.

I would like to see agents have the ability to be weighted so when a job runs, it will run on the next agent in line with the highest weight.  This way the jobs that are assigned to only those specific agents can still run with a lesser chance of other jobs being run there.

This is different from the other issues where people are asking to weight plans.  I am asking to be able to assign weight to specific agents within a plan.
fields.summary: Assign weight in plan for specific agents

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce on BRMP 2.0.4:
1. deselect checkbox under 'Tag Unreleased Versions?' (so that only released versions will be tagged) Or viceversa
2. click save
3. the config change has no affect, the unreleased version are still tagged

Screencast: http://screencast.com/t/rmdHKa8f4A
fields.summary: Can't deselect tag Versions checkbox in BRMP

fields.description:
Would be good to have an option that defines if the build will fail or not when a dependency calculation problem fails.

If the build is still successful when the calculation fails, the Plan owner may want it to be set as a success.

Before 3.1 the builds were still passing when the calculation failed.
fields.summary: Maven Plan dependency calculation should not fail the build.

fields.description: When you rerun the failed tests from a build or start an optional stage in a build the page refreshes at such a fast rate that it does not fully render, it looks like the whole page is surrounded by <blink> tags.
fields.summary: Whole page refreshes and does not have time to fully render when queued for rerunning failed tests or optional stages

fields.description:
Our software generates a lot of extra code during build/init/testing. If we would use the SVN Update functionality we would not get the same results as with a clean checkout. Therefor we always have to overwrite the current SvnRepository plugin to inject a self-written tool before the update method that deletes all files in the working directory, that aren't under version control. 

Would be much easier for us if we could just implement that via PreCheckoutAction. There are several other use-cases we would like to have that Action for : 
* Release file locks in working directory
* Check environment before checkout (e.g. hard disk full?)
fields.summary: PreCheckoutAction - Execute java code on agent before repositry checkout

fields.description:
I have a Bamboo plugin with a webwork (xwork) action.

If I reinstall the plugin using the UPM (e.g. after making some changes to it) then I get a "Page Not Found" error when navigating to the action 

But if I bring up a new Bamboo instance (e.g. using mvn bamboo:debug) then I can navigate to the action just fine
fields.summary: Bamboo doesn't like it when plugins are reinstalled?

fields.description:
While investigating the unicorn elastic bamboo issues, I discovered that bamboo 3.1.4 elastic functionality doesn't work at all when there is an outgoing http proxy.

Further analysis with Marek's help traced this to a change in atlassian-aws (bamboo 3.0.x uses atlassian-aws 0.15, 3.1.4 uses atlassian-aws 0.18). I made a change to atlassian-aws and after uploading the patched jar, the problem was resolved. See https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/AWSLIB-16 for details.

I think this problem will affect not only unicorn, but any bamboo instance that uses an outgoing http proxy (specifically, the https.proxyHost and https.proxyPort java system properties). It will also affect bamboo 3.2.x as well.

To fix, we'll need to release new versions of atlassian-aws, and change the relevant bamboo branches to use the correct atlassian-aws version.

It's a simple fix, and I've supplied a patch on AWSLIB-16, but I wasn't sure where all to apply the changes (since there are lots of atlassian-aws and bamboo versions floating around).

Let me know, and I can go ahead and commit the necessary changes.
fields.summary: Elastic bamboo doesn't work when there is an outgoing http proxy since changing from using Typica to Amazon AWS in atlassian-aws

fields.description:
I created a forum posting that discussed this: http://forums.atlassian.com/message.jspa?messageID=257356762.

Our build environment consists of six different SVN repositories that branch at different times in our release cycle.  We have multiple plans that build from the same repository so we define our SVN URLs as global variables.  As we branch and create new plans, it would be ideal if the global SVN variables could be updated/defined via the REST API.  This is currently a manual task.
fields.summary: Allow for creation, deletion and modification of global variables via the Bamboo REST API

fields.description:
I get a NullPointerException when I try to save the elastic bamboo configuration page.
The problem can be reproduced by following these steps:

1. Enable the checkbox "Upload AWS account identifiers to new elastic instances (mandatory if EBS Snapshot ID specified for Elastic Image Configuration)"
2. Change "Key files location" to "Files will be uploaded from your PC"
3. Disable the checkbox
4. Save

Attached is the stacktrace of the NPE.

fields.description:
Bamboo embeds Maven 2.1.0 to read project metadata for the Automatic Dependency task. This version of Maven has problems reading POM and metadata files built with Maven 3.0.x.

This change cannot be back ported to 3.2.x as changing the Maven version has certain risks attached to it that can only be mitigated by a full release of Bamboo by running through teams quality control process.

fields.description:
Description: Current HTTP headers do not contain the X-FRAME-Option, which helps prevents against Clickjacking attacks. A Clickjacking attack is similar to CSRF in which attacker can hijack a "click" on a web application from another "invisible" frame in the browser. Essentially, an attacker can force a user to click on a button that is invisible to him/her.

Exploit Scenario: An attacker crafts a malicious page such that when their victim clicks, they are actually clicking on the link or button in the vulnerable application hosted in an iframe. Thus, an attacker tricks the user into performing an action of the attacker's choosing by directing mouse input to the target application.

Short Term Solution: There are 2 options in the HTTP response header for projection, include:

DENY: If the header contains the DENY option, then the response will not be loaded within a frame.
SAMEORIGIN: If the header contains the SAMEORIGIN option, the response will be loaded within a frame only if the parent page is from the same origin.

Examples below:

Apache:
Add this to your httpd.conf:
Header always append x-frame-options SAMEORIGIN

Note that this is not a panacea for clickjacking.

SAMEORIGIN should be safe to use. See also [JST-5291|https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/JST-5291?focusedCommentId=47107&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-47107]
fields.summary: Enable X-FRAME-Option in HTTP response headers in order to improve clickjacking protection

fields.description:
I would very much like to not have to update my 50 remote agents when I upgrade my Bamboo Server.  While I manage my remote agents with Puppet, I still need to have downtime on them to update their agent jar file.  

When the agent starts up it should do a version check with the server prior to accepting builds and then update itself if necessary.
fields.summary: Bamboo remote agent jar should automatically upgrade itself when the server upgrades to new versions

fields.description:
1) Lets create a new plan that contain two stages. The second is manual.
2) Lets create two jobs for the first stage, let the first job have for example 'script exit 0', let the second have *NO* tasks at all.
3) Lets create some jobs for the manual stage.
4) Run the plan.
5) First job should be successful, second job (from stage one) should be orange (failed).
6) There is no 'continue' button in navigation plan. On build summary there is a button "Rerun incomplete jobs", hit it. 
7a) I've expected that the second job will be rerun (from the first stage).
7b) Instead my plan had proceed to stage two.
fields.summary: Either the button name is incorrect or there is a bug in job's rerun logic.

fields.description: When using the wallboard you can click on the build and more details are shown for the build (Tests, duration etc). However the automatic refreshing of the wallboard causes this state to be lost and the display goes back to the smaller version. You would expect it to stay in the same state, i.e. with the details being show, after a refresh. Otherwise this feature is pretty useless if it is being as a wallboard, as you don't usually interact with it very often.
fields.summary: Wallboard refresh resets the state of the build details

fields.description: After upgrade the "crowd.properties", "atlassian-user.xml" and "crowd-ehcache.xml" files will still be on the old "BAMBOO/webapp/WEB-INF/classes" folder. However, changing them no longer take effect.
fields.summary: Documentation: Need to document that the crowd.properties and atlassian-user.xml in the old directories are no longer used after upgrade

fields.description:
- Upgrade bamboo with a crowd.properties file that does not contain an entry for "bamboo.crowd.cache.minutes"
- Login, and go to User Management page

*Expected*: The Cache Refresh Interval to be set to default value (60).
fields.summary: User Management: If cache refresh interval was not specified on the crowd.properties file, upon upgrade the Cache Refresh Interval should be set to default value

fields.description: Bamboo exposes metadata for Project, Plan and Jobs.   With the introduction of grouping into Stages and the granularity of Tasks, our build process needs to know the execution hierarchy.   Can we get the bamboo stage and task exposed as metadata.   Exposing this data as optionally appended to the build key would be preferred.   Alternatively as new metadata called buildStage and buildTask.
fields.summary: Expose metadata for bamboo stages and tasks

fields.description:
After restarting our Bamboo 3.1.4 server this morning, we noticed no notifications were being sent.
When we attempted to send a test mail from the admin interface, Bamboo threw a exception.
All of the settings appeared to be correct, but we clicked the edit button.
Without changing any of the settings, we tried sending a test mail from the edit screen, and it worked without issue.
We saved the configuration (having changed nothing) and emails started sending again.
However, the issue seems to re-appear if you restarted Bamboo.
Below is the stack-trace seen in the logs when builds attempt to send notifications while the error appears.
{noformat}
2011-07-18 07:13:19,192 ERROR [AtlassianEvent::0-BAM::EVENTS:pool-1-thread-16] [EmailListener] Failed to find mail server
java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: "null"
        at java.lang.NumberFormatException.forInputString(NumberFormatException.java:48)
        at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Integer.java:449)
        at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Integer.java:499)
        at com.sun.mail.smtp.SMTPTransport.protocolConnect(SMTPTransport.java:398)
        at javax.mail.Service.connect(Service.java:288)
        at javax.mail.Service.connect(Service.java:169)
        at javax.mail.Service.connect(Service.java:118)
        at javax.mail.Transport.send0(Transport.java:188)
        at javax.mail.Transport.send(Transport.java:118)
        at alt.javax.mail.TransportImpl.send(TransportImpl.java:18)
        at com.atlassian.mail.server.impl.SMTPMailServerImpl.send(SMTPMailServerImpl.java:155)
        at com.atlassian.bamboo.mail.EmailListener.handleEvent(EmailListener.java:64)
        at com.atlassian.event.legacy.LegacyListenerHandler$LegacyListenerInvoker.invoke(LegacyListenerHandler.java:55)
        at com.atlassian.event.internal.AsynchronousAbleEventDispatcher$2.run(AsynchronousAbleEventDispatcher.java:60)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.runTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:886)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:908)
        at com.atlassian.bamboo.build.pipeline.concurrent.NamedThreadFactory$2.run(NamedThreadFactory.java:50)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:662)
{noformat}
fields.summary: Bamboo throws NumberFormatException when trying to send mail

fields.description:
e.g. if a plan is something that deploys a SNAPSHOT to somewhere.  If the build is rerun after a later build has been completed, it will overwrite the newer snapshot with an older one.

Perhaps we could provide the ability to lock down certain plans to avoid users making mistakes.
fields.summary: Be able to turn off the ability rerunning of failed builds.

fields.description: We changed the way we export dependencies at some stage.  The code to import the legacy dependencies does not work.
fields.summary: Bamboo fails to import legacy plan dependencies

fields.description:
This feature request relates to: BAM-247

currently the build strategy can only be configured on the build plan.
it would be nice to allow a stage or task to have their own build strategy / execution trigger.

So one could create one plan for continuous builds (triggered by VCS changes), a nightly build (fixed timely trigger) and a release build (manual)
fields.summary: Allow stages an tasks to have their own 'Build Strategy' (trigger to run the goal)
Test that Fresh Bamboo installation uses the configuration chosen in the setup process.
Allow configuring Crowd in the Bamboo setup process

fields.description: If crowd has a large user base, the sync process can take minutes. Showing a time of 138000ms is non-intuitive.
fields.summary: User Management page: Show minutes/seconds instead of milliseconds for synchronization time on the status

fields.description:
When a user switches from local to remote management system, if a user with the same username and group membership does not exist on the remote user base, the user will be automatically logged off. 

This can surprise users. The recommendation is to warn the user of this possibility, either by actually checking that the user store has the user with correct permissions, or just a text on the screen.
fields.summary: User Management page: When switching user management system, the page should inform that current user may be logged out.

fields.description:
There are cases when the user can be totally left locked out of their bamboo instance after they have switched to use remote repository

1. bamboo admin ceases to exist. In this case, the user needs to re add a user to the bamboo-admin group on remote server and wait for a sync to bamboo (or they can restart bamboo)

2. Can no longer connect to the remote server. In this case, if the remote server has gone down and a user needs to switch to local repo, they need to manually edit the atlassian-user.xml.
fields.summary: Documentation: Document what to do when connecting to a remote user repository and the server goes down.

fields.description:
- In Crowd/JIRA add a directory to an LDAP server with many users and groups (I reproes with 1,000 users and 500 groups)
- In bambo, under User Management, click on remote user repository and configure for Crowd
- Click save. At this point a sync will begin.
- While sync is going, switch to local user repository

*Expected*: Sync to be aborted and local user base to be loaded

*Actual*: UI gives the appearance that user base has been changed (no status message). However, reloading the page re-selects the remote user base radio button.

    Note: the problem is that the remote sync is still happening when the user creates the action to change to local user base, and it is not stopped.
fields.summary: User Management: Cannot change user base after a sync has begun but UI gives the impression that it did.

fields.description: We should explain how to create labels. A subtle hint at the bottom of this dialog should do the trick.
fields.summary: Add a hint to the filter plans popup on the Dashboard.

fields.description: - In Crowd, add a user and a group with name "国際" - In Bamboo, switch user base to use the remote crowd server - Go to the "Manage Users" screen - Next to the "国際" user, click on Edit *Expected*: Edit user screen to appear with no error *Actual*: Error appears on the screen (attached below). In the middle of the screen the form renders amongst error message with an error: Unable to find the user. The username å›½éš› may be incorrect. Note, other errors occur for the following actions: delete user, edit group, delete group (attached stack traces)
fields.summary: User Management: Errors performing user management actions on bamboo when user/group has non ascii characters names.

fields.description:
- Login to bamboo using local user base
- Go to User Management screen
- Click on remote user base radio button

*Expected*: Since the server has not been configured, expected the password field to be visible and no Change Password checkbox.

*Actual*: Password field is not present. "Change Password" checkbox is miss leading, the password hasn't been set yet.
fields.summary: User Management: If remote user base has not been configured the password textbox should be visible.
Update and Release JMeter Plugin

fields.description:
Some users report that Bamboo starts using the first java command on the PATH, rather than respecting the exported JAVA_HOME varible.

This is inconsistent iwth other Atlassian tools, for example, JIRA, which look at the JAVA_HOME variable when starting.

We need to test this behaviour for:
# Bamboo server itself
# Bamboo agents.

For more information that caused this issue see:
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-9284?page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel&focusedCommentId=258775#comment-258775
fields.summary: Modify Bamboo and Bamboo agents to first use the JAVA_HOME variable when starting

fields.description:
We currently display 2 error messages. One by default and the same one again once we save. 

We should also be more explicit and say what repository types are supported if we have that information.
fields.summary: Fix error messages for VCS Tasks
NANT task cannot handle executable with relative path name (when NANT toolkit is a part of checkout)

fields.summary: Bamboo server crashing - and following error reported - fatal error detected by JRE.

fields.description:
Mark, as discussed yesterday, we are having problems with elastic bamboo on unicorn. These problems may well be due to the environment (in particular the outgoing http proxy that everything on unicorn needs to go through), but I think we do need the bamboo team's help to get to the bottom of this. I talked to Przemek last night as you suggested, and he did provide some very valuable input.

I've attached the agent and server logs for 1 failure scenario here:

{noformat}
This happened on zxu.jira-dev.com. I created 3 agents in total. 
1 agent was busy running a build, and the other 2 agents were both idle, 
but a build was still queuing, waiting for an available agent. 

We can see some exceptions in the the server log and agent log of the 2 idle agents.
{noformat}
fields.summary: Elastic bamboo very unstable on Unicorn

fields.description:
Upgrade to Bamboo 3.1.4 resulted in any build plans using system.path variable in their build plans on windows build agents, to fail to complete with the error below. This error resulted in the build being 'cancelled' as it could not update the build status. The 'jobs' went through OK .. but the builds were never completing. 

I have confirmed that the system.variable had not changed at all in length or usage from before the upgrade. I have found a workaround to this issue so that my builds can actually complete, by using the %path% instead as that does not get inserted into the database,
This may be related to the fix for BAM-9067. It looks as though this system.path is being inserted into the database now, and the string is too long. 
 
Could not save the build results. Data could be in an inconsistent state.
(org.springframework.dao.DataIntegrityViolationException : Hibernate operation: Could not execute JDBC batch update; SQL []; Batch entry 3 insert into VARIABLE_SUBSTITUTION (VARIABLE_KEY, VARIABLE_VALUE, VARIABLE_TYPE, BUILDRESULTSUMMARY_ID, VARIABLE_SUBSTITUTION_ID) values ('Path', E'C:\\Perl\\site\\bin;C:\\Perl\\bin;C:\\Program Files\\HP\\NCU;C:\\WINDOWS\\system32;C:\\WINDOWS;C:\\WINDOWS\\System32\\Wbem;C:\\svn-win32-1.6.6\\bin;C:\\Program Files\\HP\\HP BTO Software\\bin;C:\\Program Files\\HP\\HP BTO Software\\bin\\OpC;C:\\Program Files\\Microsoft SQL Server\\100\\Tools\\Binn\\;C:\\Program Files\\Microsoft SQL Server\\100\\DTS\\Binn\\;C:\\utils;C:\\diab\\5.3.0.0\\WIN32\\bin;C:\\Program Files\\Windows Imaging\\;c:\\diab\\5.3.0.0\\WIN32\\bin;c:\\utils', 'SYSTEM', '68847703', '69044156') was aborted. fields.description:
Bamboo 3.1 Upgrade Guide:

{quote}
Upgrading from Bamboo prior to 3.0

In addition to the notes below, please read the Upgrade Guide for every version you are skipping during the upgrade. The complete list of Upgrade Guides is available here.
Notes for upgrading from Bamboo 2.6.x

    You will need to upgrade to Bamboo 2.7.4 before upgrading to Bamboo 3.0. 
{quote}

Bamboo should prevent user from upgrading directly from versions < 2.7.4

fields.description:
We use plan variables for releasing our project with Maven. Our variable contains a long string with the release command. Unfortunately this string is too long for bamboo and we cannot save the variable value.

Here is the variable value that does not fit:

org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-release-plugin:2.2:prepare org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-release-plugin:2.2:perform --batch-mode -Dtag=${bamboo.releaseTag} -DreleaseVersion=${bamboo.releaseVersion} -DdevelopmentVersion=${bamboo.nextVersion} -Dusername=bamboo -DcheckModificationExcludeList=build-number.txt

Please increase the size of the variable value. At least make sure that the input field for the value is at max as long as the database column size.
fields.summary: Increase plan variable length in database

fields.description:
There are cases where an action that occurred after the sync worker has started, invalidates the results (for example, user has changed to a local user repository, a flush action has been invoked). In this cases, any errors that the worker might produce should be caught and just logged as warning messages.

fields.summary: User Management: Exporting backup while user base is configured for remote repository does not include the local users

fields.description:
- Switch to remote crowd directory for user base.
- Export a backup of bamboo's settings
- Switch to local user base.
- Import the backup, choose "Apply changes without server restart"

*Expected*: Configuration to be loaded from backup and users to get synched.

*Actual*: Configuration is applied, but users are not synched. User is logged out and can't log back in again.

Notes:
- Even though when I took the backup, I had the refresh frequency at 1 minute, after I restored the backup, I thought that after 1 minute the users would be synced. However, this did not happen. It is possible that the refresh frequency did not got restored and was set to default 60 minutes, but this is speculation.
fields.summary: User Management: When importing backup that was configured with remote user repository the user base is not synched

fields.description:
This is similar to BAM-9273, the difference is the method in which the user/group ended up being removed from bamboo (due to switch of repository, or removed from remote repo on sync)

- Go to User management page.
- Switch to remote crowd user repository that contains at least one group and one user
- Go to Global Permissions page.
- Grant admin permission to the remote group and the remote user
- On the remote repository, delete the user and group
- Flush the cache and sync.
- Go to Global Permissions page

Expected: permission to remote group and user to be gone.

Actual: Permissions are still there.
fields.summary: Permissions granted to remote users and groups are not removed when entity is removed from remote user repository

fields.description:
- Go to User management page.
- Switch to remote crowd user repository that contains at least one group
- Go to Global Permissions page.
- Grant admin permission to the remote group
- Switch to local user repository
- Go to Global Permissions page

*Expected*: permission to remote group to be gone.

*Actual*: Permission is still there.


Note: Does not repro for remote users that where added in this manner. I dont know enough of bamboo to make a call if this might have any negative impact.
fields.summary: Permission granted to remote group is not removed when switching from remote to local user repository

fields.description:
- Go to user management admin page
- Switch to a remote crowd repository that does not allow modifications
- In bamboo, attempt to create a user

*Expected*: a) Error message stating that user repository does not allow this operation

*Actual*: UndeclaredThrowableException (below). Note that these operations also fail with unhandled exceptions:
- Create user
- Update user
- Delete user
- Create group
- Modify group membership
- Delete group

fields.summary: Unhandled exceptions when performing a user management operation that remote user repository does not allow

fields.description: Most users would expect their user base to be synced immediately when they click on "flush the cache" link, specially once we implement some form of error reporting.
fields.summary: User Management: Automatically sync users when cache is flushed.

fields.description:
Look at: https://bamboo.extranet.atlassian.com/browse/CONFFUNC-CDOG-486

The sum of the build stages is ~20 minutes, however the time shown to run the plan is sitting at 2016 minutes, blowing the average right out.

I suspect this is calculated based on start and end times, rather than running times of each stage.

It would be good to show the correct build time when using manual stages, so that we can determine a correct average running time.
fields.summary: Manual stages cause build time to blow out to massive numbers

fields.summary: Error on import  - legacy JIRA servers mapper

fields.description:
- Go to user management page
- Switch to remote crowd server that does not include a group named "bamboo-admin"

*Expected*: Error message to specify that the remote user repository is missing a bamboo-admin group with at least one user.

*Actual*: Error message says "Failed to connect to remote Atlassian user repository."
fields.summary: User Management: Improve error message when connecting to a crowd server that does not have a bamboo-admin group
Internal server error when creating a user that already exists on crowd user base with different casing.

fields.description: Currently only a static error message is displayed.
fields.summary: Log exception and display more information when user repository switching fails

fields.description: Bamboo could generate SSH keys itself, then make the public key available to cut and paste into the code hosting site with an appropriate comment (bamboo@hostname).
fields.summary: Generate SSH keys in Bamboo

fields.description:
I've configured a Git repository with a passphrased SSH key, which works on my machine with SSH, but it's not working. The error I get says that authentication has failed.

After I use {{ssh-keygen -p}} to remove the passphrase the key works. I'd like to have more information about why the passphrase fails; maybe checking that it's valid when I configure it rather than waiting for a connection.
fields.summary: Git SSH private key authentication with a passphrase does not give a clear reason on failure

fields.summary: User Management: Illegal argument exception when using an invalid server url

fields.description:
This is exposed by related bug https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-9258, however, a guard might be useful to have on bamboo's side.

- Switch  user base to use a remote crowd server
- Type in incorrect password and click save (an error will show)
- Go to "Users" page
- Type anything in the search box and click Search

*Expected*: an error saying that a problem occurred with the user base and for user to go look at logs. 

*Actual*: NullPointerException

fields.summary: Unhandled exception when searching for users and remote user base has been configured with incorrect credentials

- Type in incorrect password and click save
- An error will show

*Expected*: Sync to continue to work

*Actual*: The wrong password was saved and all syncs start to fail.

fields.summary: User Management: When saving, settings are updated even if they are incorrect/invalid

fields.description:
- Login with local
- Go to User Management
- Select remote radio button

*Expected*: No flush link, or disabled (there is nothing to flush isnce I haven't changed yet)

*Actual*: Flush link is there, user can click on it but it looks like the page is just refreshed.
fields.summary: User Management: Remove or disable the flush cache link if the user base is set to local

fields.description: JIRA, Confluence and Crowd's use the term to "Synchronize" for the action of getting the user/groups information from the underlying user management system into the application. Bamboo should do the same.
fields.summary: User Management: Use term "Synchronize" instead of flush cache to be consistent with JIRA, Confluence and Crowd

fields.description:
- Go to User Management page.
- Change user base to a remote crowd server that does not include the current logged in user.

*Expected*: As soon as operation completes, user should be redirected to login page

*Actual*: User stays on user management page (although his/her status is now logged out)
fields.summary: User Management: After changing user base, if user gets logged out it should redirect to login page

fields.description:
- Login with admin user
- Navigate to http://localhost:9099/bamboo/userlogin!default.action?os_destination=%2Fadmin%2FuserManagement!execute.action

*Expected*: Radio button to be selected for the current user base in use

*Actual*: No radio button is selected

User scenario: 
# user loads the user management page, 
# their session expires, 
# they click "Save",
# they get redirected to login page, with the url used in repro step
# user management page loads with no selection.
fields.summary: User Management: Navigating directly to the execute action does not select any radio button.
